Which of the following methods is commonly used to determine the minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of an antibiotic?
The minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) is typically expressed in
Which of the following best describes the minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of an antibiotic?

answers.a: The highest concentration of an antibiotic that kills all bacteria in a sample.
answers.b: The lowest concentration of an antibiotic that inhibits visible bacterial growth.
answers.c: The concentration of an antibiotic required to prevent bacterial resistance.
answers.d: The concentration of an antibiotic that exhibits side effects in the host.

questions.question: What is the purpose of determining the MIC of an antibiotic?

answers.a: To assess the cost-effectiveness of the antibiotic
answers.b: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of the antibiotic
answers.c: To guide appropriate dosage and treatment duration
answers.d: To measure the toxicity of the antibiotic
